summary: This document is an AT&T phone bill covering usage from January 1, 2003, to December 31, 2006, for a specific subscriber account. It details numerous calls made to and from locations including New York, Florida, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, showing a pattern of frequent communication between these areas. The bill was produced as evidence, likely for a grand jury, as indicated by the SDNY_GN1 reference numbers. This document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from late January through early March 2003. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from New York, with additional calls to locations including Miami, Chicago, the U.S. Virgin Islands, France, the United Kingdom, and South Africa. The bill includes roaming charges from St. Thomas, VI, and appears to be evidence of communication patterns during the investigation. This document is an AT&T phone bill (account number 448193) dated July 1, 2008, detailing billed usage from February and March 2003. It shows numerous local, long-distance, and international calls, primarily to/from New York, NY, and Florida (especially West Palm Beach), with some calls to international networks. The document appears to be a financial record subpoenaed as evidence, likely to establish communication patterns and locations. This document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from March 22, 2003, to May 1, 2003. It shows numerous calls to and from locations associated with Jeffrey Epstein, including New York, Florida, the US Virgin Islands, and international numbers, providing a log of communication patterns during this period. This document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from May 1-16, 2003, and includes roaming charges from Brazil in April 2003. It shows a high volume of calls to/from New York, NY, with specific calls to locations like West Palm Beach, FL, and Bethesda, MD, and one full phone number (516-578-7888). The bill was part of the evidence collection in the Epstein case, likely to establish communication patterns and travel. This document is a detailed AT&T telephone billing record for account number 448193, covering usage from May 19, 2003, to June 17, 2003. It shows numerous calls to and from locations including New York, Miami, West Palm Beach, Bethesda, and international networks, with a significant volume of calls to the United Kingdom. The record appears to be part of financial or communication evidence in the Epstein case. This document is an AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from June to August 2003. It details numerous calls made to and from locations including New York, Florida, the United Kingdom, France, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, showing a pattern of frequent communication and travel. The bill appears to be part of financial records collected in the investigation. This document is a detailed AT&T telephone billing statement from September 2003, showing numerous calls made and received from a specific number (448193). The log shows a high volume of calls between New York, Florida (Miami, West Palm Beach), and international locations, suggesting extensive communication activity potentially related to travel coordination and business operations during this period. This document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from August 26, 2008, to September 12, 2008. It shows numerous calls placed to and from locations including New York, NY; Bethesda, DC; West Palm Beach, FL; and international numbers in the United Kingdom, Spain, Austria, and Sweden. The bill includes call details, messaging charges, and roaming charges. This document is an AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, dated October 14, 2003, detailing billed usage from September 6-30, 2003. It shows numerous calls to/from locations including New York, Miami, Bethesda, and international calls to the United Kingdom. The document appears to be evidence of communication patterns during this period. This document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from late September to late October 2003. It shows numerous incoming and outgoing calls, primarily to/from New York, NY, and includes roaming charges from Great Britain. The bill details call durations, charges, and locations, serving as a record of communication patterns. This document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from October 22, 2003, to November 12, 2003. It shows numerous calls to and from New York, Los Angeles, Miami, and international locations like Spain, Sweden, Norway, Belgium, Hong Kong, and China, as well as messaging and roaming charges. The bill appears to be part of the evidence collected in the Epstein case, likely documenting communication patterns. This document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from November 2003. It shows extensive international and domestic calls, including to locations like India, the UK, and various US cities, as well as roaming charges from China. The bill is part of the evidence collection in the Epstein case, likely used to track communications and travel patterns. This document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for account number 448193, covering usage from November 2003 through January 2004. It shows numerous calls to and from locations associated with Jeffrey Epstein, including New York, Palm Beach, Miami, and the Virgin Islands, as well as international calls. The bill was produced as evidence, likely in 2008, for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) investigation. This document is a set of AT&T phone billing records for account number 448193, covering usage from December 2003 through January 2004. It details numerous calls, including many to/from New York, Chicago, Miami, and international calls to Switzerland and France, as well as frequent calls to a location in Moriarty, NM. The records were produced as part of the Epstein case investigation.

keyFacts: The document is a detailed AT&T phone bill for an account spanning from 2003 to 2006, subpoenaed as evidence (SDNY_GN1).
Call patterns show heavy communication between New York and Florida, particularly West Palm Beach and Miami.
Roaming charges indicate the phone was used in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, in early January 2003.
Frequent incoming calls and call retrievals suggest active, two-way communication on this line.
The bill includes calls to locations like Santa Fe, NM, and Bethesda, DC, indicating a wide geographic network of contacts.
The phone bill (account 448193) shows extensive calling activity from February 2, 2003, through March 8, 2003.
A significant number of calls are placed to and from New York City, with other frequent locations including Miami, Chicago, and international destinations.
Roaming charges indicate the phone was used in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, in late January 2003.
International calls were made to France, the United Kingdom, and South Africa in February 2003.
The document is a billing record dated July 1, 2008, suggesting it was obtained later as part of an investigation into historical communications.
The document is an AT&T phone bill for account 448193, billed on July 1, 2008, for usage in February and March 2003.
It shows extensive calling activity, with hundreds of calls logged, including local, long-distance, and international calls.
A significant portion of the calls in mid-March 2003 are to and from Florida, specifically the West Palm Beach area.
The bill records calls to various U.S. cities and international networks, indicating wide-ranging communication.
The document is marked as proprietary AT&T information and is part of the SDNY grand jury evidence (SDNY_GN1 series).

It shows extensive communication between New York, Florida, and the US Virgin Islands (St. Croix), locations central to Epstein's residences and operations.
There are numerous incoming and outgoing calls, as well as call retrievals (voicemail checks), indicating high phone activity.
International calls are logged to the United Kingdom and other destinations, suggesting global contacts.
The document is a billing record subpoenaed as evidence, likely used to establish communication patterns, travel, and associations.
